conclusion: Need to use the ideal gas law with p-T and V-T graphs to find pressure at 600 K.
Understand problem and given data: two graphs for p vs. T and V vs. T; find pressure at 600 K.
Relationship between p and T is linear; calculate slope m = 2500 Pa/K.
Using point-slope form, derive equation p = 2500T - 350000.
V-T graph: At T = 400 K, V = 2.5 m³; At T = 600 K, V = 3.0 m³.
Relationship between V and T is linear; confirm V at 600 K is 3.0 m³.
Use ideal gas law PV = nRT to relate P and V at different temperatures.
Calculate P2 using ratio: P2 = 1.25 × 10^5 Pa.
Pressure of the gas at 600 K is 1.25 × 10^5 Pa.
